bibl.title: Letter from [Caroline Latimer] to Edwin Denby, November 2, 1907

div1.p: [Latimer] thanks Denby for his efforts regarding the Kissinger pension bill.

div1.head: Letter from [Caroline Latimer] to Edwin Denby, November 2, 1907
div1.opener:
1418 EUTAW PLACE
November 2, 1907
Hon. Edwin Denby,
Dear Sir =
div1.p:
Dr. Kelly is away for a
day or two and has desired me to thank
you for your kind letter regarding the
bill for Kissinger, the acknowledgment of
which has been unavoidable delayed.

Dr. Kelly will be most glad to follow
your suggestion of introducing the bill
through yourself and Mr. Mudd in the House
at the same time that Mr. Whyte does so in
the Senate; and he will collect and send you
the data which you mention.

Kissinger does not need any further
assistance at present, as his immediate
necessities are provided for through the
generous subscription of last summer.
